_header: A wild beast a man may tame / A womans tongue will never be lame
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 47.
Subjects: satire; women, satire directed against; tongue, woman’s
_description: Proverbial couplet comparing man’s ability to tame a wild beast and his ability to tame a woman’s tongue — one couplet

CamSidney99.Transcription:
All wylde beastes a man maye tameBut a woomanes tongue will never be
                    lameAll wilde beastes a man maye Make MeekeBut a woomanes aunswer ys
                    never to seeke
CamSidney99.Note:
Expanded version of 4 lines; in unfoliated MS; added to lower
                    margin.
CamSidney99.folio: verso & recto of lower margin of Epistle to Hebrews XI

BLRoy12Exvi.Transcription:
A wyld heart a man may tamea womanes tunge will neuer be
                    lame
BLRoy12Exvi.Note: Written as prose. Marginal inscription. Followed by 132.

GULHun230.Transcription:
A weld best a man may meykeA womanis answere is never for to
                    seyke
GULHun230.Note:
Included in 2728; added
                    to end flyleaf by hand of s. xvi.
